intro: Sclerochiton tanzaniensis, commonly known as Tanzanian hard-shelled thorn, is a shrub native to East Africa. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and yellowish flowers. The plant produces small, globose fruits that are typically covered in a hard, spiny coating. It thrives in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in woodland and savanna areas. Due to its unique morphology and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and ecologists studying plant adaptations in arid environments.
